lines.gurmukhi: pUrn bHm Awp Awpn hI Awip swij Awpn ricE hY nwau Awip hY ibcwir kY
lines.transliteration_english: Pooran Braham Aap Aapan Hee Aapi Saaji , Aapan Rachiao Hai Naau Aapi Hai Bichaari Kai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Omniscient and Omnipotent God Himself has created His own form and has named Himself as (Guru) Nanak.

lines.gurmukhi: Awid gur duqIAw goibMd khwieau gurmuK rcnw Akwr EAMkwr kY
lines.transliteration_english: Aadi Gur Douteeaa Gobind Kahaaiu , Gurmoukh Rachanaa Akaar Aoankaar Kai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: The second name that He called Himself is Gobind. The transcendental Lord took the immanent form to appear as the first Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK nwd byd gurmuiK pwvY Byd gurmuiK lIlwDwrI Aink Aauqwr kY
lines.transliteration_english: Gurmukhi Naad Bayd Gurmukhi Paavai Bhayda , Gurmukhi Leelaadhaaree Anik Aoutaar Kai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Lord Himself is the precept of Vedas and He Himself knows all the secrets that lie therein. Lord Himself has created this wonderful act and is manifesting in many forms and bodies

lines.gurmukhi: gur goibMd AE goibMd gur eykmyk Eiq poiq sUqR giq AMbr aucwr kY ]54]
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Gobind Aao Gobind Gur Aykamayka , Aoti Poti Sootr Gati Anbar Ouchaar Kai ?54?

Shabad OS B.translation: Like waft and woof of a cloth, both Guru and Gobind (God) are not different to each other. (54)
